content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0)
Used for converting iron ore and coal into iron plates. In step 1821 the agent retrieved an alternative furnace at this location and used it to insert ore and coal, later extracting 30 iron plates.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0)
Used for transforming copper ore and coal into copper plates. In step 1822 the agent retrieved a copper furnace, inserted 50 copper ore and coal, and then extracted 45 copper plates.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• When calling the entity‐retrieval function:
  – Avoid using unexpected keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or extra positional arguments.
  – Ensure that the function is invoked following its correct signature so that it returns an iterable result rather than None.

• During Lab placement and crafting:
  – Confirm that the required Lab item is available in inventory before attempting to place it.
  – Before crafting a Lab, verify that all dependent sub‐ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are available. Missing ingredients repeatedly lead to crafting failures.
  – Guard against iterating over a NoneType object by checking that retrieved entity lists are valid prior to filtering.

• In resource-dependent operations:
  – Ensure that smelting or resource production processes are sufficiently established to meet sub-ingredient requirements for advanced crafting.
